name: Abyssinian
fact: Oldest breeds and is believed to have origins in  Ancient Egypt.

name: Aegean
fact: Native to the  Cyclic Islands of Greece and is one of the few naturally occurring breeds.

name: American Curl
fact: They have curled-back ears, which are the result of a natural genetic mutation.

name: American Bobtail
fact: Known or their small tail and their loving and fond personalities

name: American  Short hair
fact: Known for their longevity and robust health.

name: American Wirehair
fact: Have a unique wiry coat that is resilient to matting and dirt.

name: Balinese
fact: Long-haired Siamese cats, known for their elegance and loud nature.

name: Bambino
fact: Hybrid breed, combining the  carelessness of the  Sphinx with the short legs of the Munchkin.

name: Bengal
fact: Known for their striking leopard-like spots and high energy levels.

name: Brazilian  Short hair
fact: A natural breed that is well-adapted to various environments.

name: British  Short hair
fact: Known for their plush coats and rounded faces.

name: British Longhair
fact: A long-haired version of the British  Short hair, with a similarly robust build.

name: Burmese
fact: Known for their silky coats and affectionate, dog-like personalities.

name: Cheetah
fact: A crossbreed between the Bengal and  Occam, known for its wild appearance and gentle temperament.

name: Cyprus
fact: They have high adaptability and hunting skills.

name: Devon Rex
fact: Has a distinctive curly coat and large, expressive eyes, and are known for their playful nature.

name: Exotic  Short hair
fact: A short-haired version of the Persian, known for their round faces and calm demeanor.

name: Foldex
fact: A mix of Scottish Fold and Exotic  Short hair, known for their folded ears and round faces.

name: German Rex
fact: Have a  cozy coat and is known for its playful nature.

name: Highlander
fact: Known for its distinctive curled ears and bobbed tail, as well as its playful and

name: Maine Coon
fact: One of the largest domesticated cat breeds and are known for their friendly and sociable nature.

name: Manx
fact: Known for its  aimlessness, although some may have short tails. They are skilled hunters.

name: Nibelung
fact: Known for their long, silky fur and striking green eyes, as well as their gentle and reserved nature.

name: Napoleon
fact: Are a combination between the Munchkin and Persian breeds, known for their small legs

name: Oriental  Short hair
fact: Have a sleek, elegant appearance and come in a wide variety of colors and patterns.

name: Oriental Longhair
fact: Are similar to Oriental  Short hairs but with a longer, silky coat.

name: Persian
fact: Known for their small and flat faces, they also need regular grooming

name: Pixie-bob
fact: They are like well known wild bobcats, with their tufted ears and short tails.

name: Ragdoll
fact: Known for their placid temperament and tendency to go limp when picked up.

name: Russian Blue
fact: Doesn't shed too much hair , good for people with allergies. Known for their short coat and are also loyal cats.

name: Savannah
fact: Combination of domestic cats with African servals, known for their exotic appearance and high energy.

name: Scottish Fold
fact: Known for their distinctive folded ears, which give them a unique appearance.

name: Siamese
fact: Known for their striking blue eyes, short coat, and vocal, social nature.

name: Snowshoe
fact: Known for their white paws  (like boots or shoes) and have a  very social nature.

name: Sphynx
fact: Hairless cats that are good for people with allergies also very energetic and love to follow you about.

name: Somali
fact: Have long-haired relatives of the Abyssinian, known for their bushy tails and playful nature.
